commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Aligning assignments with nothing after operator now works correctly
commits.body:
For example this would previously merge color and background into a single line:

    font = Helvetica
    color =
    background = black

Using colon (:) as alignment operator is a little bit special as the operator match itself is defined to match whitespace to the right of the operator, and as this is in a look-behind assertion, we cannot make it option, so aligning colon-assignments only works as long as there is at least one whitespace character after colons that otherwise have no other content after them.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
Support for additional “assignment” operators (such as +=, -=, ||=, etc.) taken from a pull request by @elia.

When using the command without a selection, we now only look at lines above/below current line for which the indentation level is the same, for example:

    while line = STDIN.gets
      size = line.size
      count += 1
    end

Will, with the insertion point on the second line, become:

    while line = STDIN.gets
      size   = line.size
      count += 1
    end
